intro: Ainsliaea lancifolia, commonly known as the lancifoliate ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that are often arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped, hence the species name "lancifolia," and are often covered in fine hairs. Ainsliaea lancifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
